attributes.action: Make it illegal to walk a dog in a public place without a lead on
attributes.background: I am seeing a lot of dog attacks lately that could have been avoided if the dog was on a lead. I think it should be the law that all dogs are on a lead in a public place

attributes.action: End the 'Special Relationship' with the USA in the event of a Trump presidency.
attributes.background: After 580,000 petitioned to ban his entry into the UK, Trump may become president. Our Special Relationship means the British people may be dragged into economic, political and military conflict by a hated man. In this time of vulnerability, the UK must distance itself from Trump's America.
attributes.additional_details: In a campaign mired in racism, xenophobia, extremism, and sexual assault, Donald Trump has outlined plans which, due to the US/UK 'Special Relationship', may endanger British citizens and interests. This includes nuclear proliferation in Korea and Japan, the abandonment of NATO, forcing Mexico to pay for a border wall, ground troops in Syria, torture, opposition to China, and potential war with Iran and North Korea. If Trump wins, the UK must take a stand against his administration.

attributes.action: Don't allow Abu Hamza back in the country to serve his prison sentence
attributes.background:
Abu Hamza is currently serving a jail sentence in America.  For many years, this preacher of hate was allowed to spout his vile and repugnant views. 
We believe that he should not be allowed back in the country to serve his sentence and should serve it in the US.

attributes.action: Make the new GCSEs begin for 2017/18 Year 7 class, and not the current Year 10.
attributes.background: Since Year 7, we have been taught under curriculum supporting the old GCSE system. Now, we are suddenly being forced to suddenly change this, and this means students are already struggling and are less likely to reach their full potential.This is affecting our futures and it needs to change.
attributes.additional_details: A lot of my teachers are unsure what to teach so suddenly with these new specifications. How are we supposed to achieve and excel with even our teachers not being sure on what we need to know? A one to two year gap until it is taught will ensure teachers can prepare properly, rather than a sudden change. Grades 9-1 are hard to distinguish for students, parents, teachers, and even employers. Did they really need to change so suddenly?

attributes.action: Government should not delay initiating secession because of Germans and French
attributes.background:
Delaying Article 50 because of German and French General Elections in 2017 is a political ruse on the part of Theresa May as the negotiations will not be affected by either result.

There is no reason why negotiations cannot start because a change will be to our advantage and make them easier.
attributes.additional_details:
At present, the two most formidable opponents of Britain in any post Brexit deal will be Merkel and Hollande.  That is the worst case scenario.

If Merkel is displaced, it will likely be by the election of candidates from the AfD.  If Hollande is displaced, it will likely be by the Front Nationale.  In both cases, they are highly Eurosceptical Parties and therefore unlikely to make it difficult for a British withdrawal. They are far more likely to give a good deal for us than at present.

attributes.action: Standardise child age groups where there is an entrance fee. 18+ is adult
attributes.background: I believe pricing of  attractions should be fair. And having to pay adult prices to gain entry to attractions, shows, holidays. Flight's etc for anyone under 18 is wrong. When you have a young family it is becoming increasingly expensive to do anything when you have to pay full price adult children
attributes.additional_details: Alton Towers Adult prices start at 12+ since when have 12 year old been adults. This is one example of countless organisations and companies that routinely choose thier own age limits for pricing. We need a country if not worldwide pricing structure so parents don't get ripped off

attributes.action: Increase government funding for mental health especially in the young
attributes.background: Mental health services have been suffering with cuts year after year, until we are now ultimately in a 'mental health crisis', so many people are suffering and nothing is being done. Our government promised us more funding and we are yet to see the action. Mental health can affect everyone.

attributes.action: To make sure every care home has CCTV  to protect the elderly
attributes.background: After my grandmother was treated appallingly by home care staff in her own home and in care homes.
attributes.additional_details:
The police have cameras attached to them and I think carers should have the same kind of thing to stop the abuse of elderly people.
My gran died from blood poisoning caused by bed sores after carers did not provide adequate care

attributes.action: To make the use of the word "midget" a hate crime.
attributes.background: The use of the word "midget" is used as a hate crime directed at people of short stature. People with restricted growth, frequently experience others insulting them either directly or indirectly with the inappropriate word "midget". This must stop! It is cruel and vile and has no place in society.
attributes.additional_details:
Restricted growth is commonly described as having a final adult height of 4’10” or less due to a medical condition.
Most people who have restricted growth have it due to a genetic condition. There are estimated to be several hundred conditions that can cause restricted growth, these can cause proportionate or disproportionate, such as Achondroplasia, restricted growth.

attributes.action: Incentivise broadband providers, only pay for the broad band you get
attributes.background: Provider use the phrase ‘up to’ so there is no incentive for them to improve the speed or systems to provide what you are paying for.  e.g  speed quoted at 20 Mbs and you get 10 Mbs then you would only pay half the cost and so on. Providers would then need to tell the truth on broad band speeds.

attributes.action: Remove the EU flag from UK driving licenses and V5 documents as soon as possible
attributes.background: The UK is now in the process of leaving the EU. It is therefore unnecessary and wrong to have important UK legal documents displaying the EU flag. Along with having a blue UK passport; UK driving licenses and V5 documents should display the Union Jack instead of the EU flag.

attributes.action: Abolish A2 motorcycle licence and become fully un-restricted after 2 years
attributes.background: Back in 2013 the UK Government changed the laws on motorcycle licence having to take additional tests after being restricted for 2 years and having to fork out more money for for another mod1 and mod2 when it should go back to how it used to be and full unrestricted after 2 years automatically
attributes.additional_details:
16 cbt - 50 cc
17 cbt - 125cx now allowing 250 cc on L plates 
19 restricted licence 
21 derestricted license 
24 and above complete a direct access 

Remove the need for additional tests once passed restricted licence stay restricted for 2 years then automatically upgrade to full derestricted licence

attributes.action: Legalise civil partnerships for heterosexual couples
attributes.background: Everyone, whether heterosexual, homosexual, or bisexual, should have the option of entering into either a marriage, or a civil partnership.

attributes.action: Stop the monitoring of benefits spending.
attributes.background: Benefit payments are a lifeline. These payments are funded by the public as an insurance against misfortune. The monitoring of these subsistence payments is a gross misuse of public money and an abuse of the public trust. People are entitled to spend their benefits as they choose.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.thecanary.co/2016/07/13/snooping-on-benefit-recipients-spending-and-is-totally-legal-with-this-phone-app/

attributes.action: Condemn the Xenophobia of UK Tabloids and Ensure EU Free Movement Continues.
attributes.background: We call on MPs to condemn incitement by our tabloid press against foreigners and enact laws making it an offence. We call for a relationship with Europe that allows free movement from the EU so talented business people, scientists, academics, skilled workers & engineers feel welcome & not hated.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/jul/11/police-blame-worst-rise-in-recorded-hate-on-eu-referendum. 
http://www.un.org/apps/news/story.asp?NewsID=50675#.V4YqavkrLmE
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/science/brexit-britain-latest-news-academics-threaten-to-quit-brain-drain-over-racist-xenophobic-eu-a7133316.html
http://blogs.lse.ac.uk/brexitvote/2016/06/29/letter-to-mps-from-a-remain-voter-a-plea-for-realism-tolerance-and-honesty/
http://nyti.ms/29H7OnH

attributes.action: Don't force hard working council tenants to pay more rent
attributes.background: George Osborne wants to enforce the law, that if you earn a household income of £30,000 or more (£40,000 in London) you will have to pay equivalent of the private renting sector as of April 2017. He describes it as the 'rich' will no longer have the privilege. Some rents will increase by 300%
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3149748/Osborne-ban-cheap-rents-middle-class-council-tenants-340-000-earning-30-000-pay-market-rate.html

I understand the cut backs are needed, however this is forcing hard working people out of their homes, becoming homeless or being forced onto benefits. The £30,000 household income should not fall into the category of the 'rich' (this is only £15,000 each!  Its encouraging not to work and earn more, but to earn less!

attributes.action: Back into society and work schemes for survivors of sexual and domestic abuse
attributes.background: lots of centres do not receive enough funding for survivors of sexual/domestic abuse, leaving the victim vulnerable and alone. Often secluded and struggling to live. There are schemes in place to help offenders of such crimes to get back into society and working but no such scheme for victims.
attributes.additional_details: In the last few years the U.K has seen massive cuts to helplines and therapy centres that provide great help to victims of abuse. A scheme was introduced that helps offenders of such abuse get back into society and start working again after their sentence or provides skills and training in prisons. Unfortunately no such scheme is in place to help victims get back into socialising, learning new skills, being able to work and sometimes even keep their homes. This needs to change.

attributes.action: Can you make funding available to GB Baseball & Softball for the 2020 Olympics?
attributes.background: With the announcement by the Olympic Organisation Committee, the sports of Baseball and Softball will be reinstated at the 2020 Olympics in Tokyo, Japan. There is over 21,000 people, youth, adult, females and males registered with the BBF & BSF and British Baseball Softball United Kingdom, who play.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a wonderful Baseball/Softball  Complex at Farnham Park, Slough. Where the games of both sports are held/played throughout the summer months.
There is also the governing bodies for Baseball and Softball.
The British Baseball Federation for baseball. (BBF)
The British Softball Federation. (BSF)
The British Baseball Softball United Kingdom. (BSUK)
The BSUK is the development  group for British Baseball and Softball.

attributes.action: Dogs to be kept on leads whilst on sports fields
attributes.background:
On ongoing issue in our society is dog walkers allowing their dogs to run freely over sporting pitches, i.e rugby, football, cricket...
At times these dogs will release on the pitches and owners will ignore the excrement and not pick it up, thus providing a huge risk to those who play on them
attributes.additional_details:
Sporting pitches experience usage from a variety of different people - the problem of dog walkers allowing their dogs to be off their lead is that they are free to excrement wherever, the majority of the time, without the owner knowing.
The danger of this on sporting pitches is that it increases the risk of a child or adult getting the faeces in their eyes leading to several physical and health risks such as going blind.

Please help stop this and provide some respect for our sportsman.

attributes.action: Don’t trigger Article 50 – just leave
attributes.background: Under international law and under Article 50 (1) itself, only notice to leave is necessary.
attributes.additional_details: if Article 50(2) is ‘triggered’ it implies that the UK government accepts that the EU will decide the conditions of UK’s withdrawal. This has serious consequences. An arbitrary two-year negotiation window; a supreme agency problem between negotiating parties. All the while we will be contributing approximately £40bn gross, or £20bn net, to the European project.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for shops to tell customers that they sell real fur
attributes.background: Many people believe that the fur industry is a thing of the past and is no longer 'fashionable,' however this is far from the truth. While it has been illegal since 2002 to farm animals for fur in the UK, it is still able to be imported, making it a £500 million industry in the UK every year.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.animalaid.org.uk/images/pdf/factfiles/fur.pdf

http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2015/11/25/faux-fur-or-real_n_8648146.html

http://www.peta.org.uk/issues/animals-not-wear/fur-trade/

attributes.action: Double the free child care hours for working parents or single working parent.
attributes.background:
More than one in four UK business leaders say employees have cut their hours because of the "high cost of childcare", a report from the British Chambers of Commerce says.

The government wants to have a lower unemployment rate, so they should consider things like this.
attributes.additional_details: UK jobless rate declined to 4.8 percent in the three months to September 2016 from 4.9 percent in the April to June period and 5.3 percent a year earlier. This could be changed if they helped us with child care costs!

attributes.action: Change divorce law! Make "no fault" divorce possible.
attributes.background: No one wants to encourage a break up. But if couples talk the D-word, it is because the marriage is over. We need a simpler, administrative process that keeps kids safe and won't break the bank. It needs to help people, so they can put their kids first!
attributes.additional_details:
The law says you have to either divorce by waiting 2 years or 5 years OR you have to choose a reason like "adultery" or "unreasonable behaviour" or "desertion". 
"Why should it be easy? Kids need their parents to stay together" I hear you say...The trouble is, lawyers get round the divorce law very easily, but at great expense to their clients. Letters about petitions back and forth, outrage at the particulars, common sense out the window. ££££ for lawyers. Madness! Sign the petition to help.

attributes.action: Establish Hallowe'en  (31st October) as an annual national statutory holiday.
attributes.background: Hallowe'en has grown in popularity in the UK as a non-religious, community event.  This celebration encourages creativity as children make costumes & characters. Trick-or-treating encourages people to get out into their neighbourhoods and enjoy a home-made, creative festival together.
attributes.additional_details:
There are no other autumn holidays in the UK and would occur at a midpoint between the August Bank Holiday and Christmas. 
2. The historic origins of Hallowe'en are outlined on the Historic UK: http://www.historic-uk.com/CultureUK/Halloween/
3. This link which outlines some risks and debunks some unfounded fears. http://content.time.com/time/nation/article/0,8599,1933329,00.html .  This holiday could promote safe driving to enable children be safe outside at all times of year.

attributes.action: Raise teachers' pay
attributes.background: Teachers are the backbone of society and there would be no future without them. Yet they so undervalued and undermined within society and do not receive a high enough wage.

attributes.action: Stop BT having the monopoly on installing phone lines so other providers can.
attributes.background: As consumers in this day and age we should be able to have options to use a company for a service or not. BT have not been able to provide myself and others on the estate with a phone line or internet services, myself since June 2016 others longer than 8 months
attributes.additional_details: some of the residents including myself on the estate have gone down the complaints route to the CEO and it's still not been resolved and no foreseeable dates for a resolution either. Only BT install phone lines then rent them to other providers. There is literally nothing any of us have been able to do. Every week we chase for an update to be told it's still being looked at. No dates no resolution and no phone line and Internet

attributes.action: Introduce LGBT relationship education, similar to heterosexual relationships.
attributes.background: If we introduce LGBT education from a young age, we are more likely to rid the country of the stigma that still affects young people, and causes bullying and harm throughout our society. Educating people will almost definitely reduce the ignorance that causes homophobia.

attributes.action: Protect consumers who experience emission problems with their diesel vehicles
attributes.background: Since 2009 diesel vehicles have been fitted with a diesel particulate filter (DPFs) to remove particles of soot etc from the exhaust to protect the environment and the air we breathe. These filters are failing or becoming clogged up and consumers are being presented with costly repair bills.
attributes.additional_details:
I personally was advised that to repair my Honda Civic which was under 4 years old and had covered 33000 miles the cost would be over £3600. Almost 20% of its cost new. Correspondence with Honda UK proved unsuccessful. Some manufacturers do not include DPF's in their warranties. 

I would like to see Manufacturers being forced to give 
1) A retrospective guarantee on DPF's for a period of 10 years or 150,000 miles
2) To recall all vehicles sold since 2009 and test the DPFs, compensating owners

attributes.action: Give drink drivers an instant 4 week jail sentence if convicted to deter them.
attributes.background: In 2014 stats show that some 220 people were killed in crashes in which a driver was over the legal limit, 880 were seriously injured. Nearly 1 in 6 of all deaths on the road involve drivers who are over the legal alcohol limit. This is still too high and people still think it's OK to drink-drive.
attributes.additional_details: A total of 613,090 people were charged with drink driving during this period. 2004 - 2014. Statistics show that 595,093 (97%) of defendants charged were subsequently convicted while 17,997 (97%) were not convicted. Taken from drink driving.org

attributes.action: Government to Stop using private enterprise caterer and return military cooks
attributes.background: At present the services use private enterprise caterer such as Sodexo Catering Services. and the standard of food provided is not to a suitable standards.  and as the cost is increasing this situation should be rectified
attributes.additional_details: As members of the services are on a compulsory pay to dine scheme and it would appear their complaints are ignored. the government must take action.  The services have to have catering staff for service in areas of hostility these should also be in charge af army cook houses

attributes.action: Make train operators legally provide adjustments for passengers with autism.
attributes.background: People with autistic spectrum disorder (ASD) experience sensory difficulties. Train operators are failing to provide or enforce, quiet carriages, or other areas free of noise, distraction or bright lights. Passengers with hidden disabilities deserve adjustments too. We demand a statory requirement.
attributes.additional_details: Passengers with autism are being forced to sit on the carpet between carriages, challenge other passengers, to get distressed, go into meltdown or experience anxiety, simply because train operators won't cater for their needs. Complaints are dismissed and excuses such as availability, company policy are trotted out by train companies. The Equality Act is not being enforced for those with hidden disabilities and sensory impairments. We demand a new statutory duty for compliance and adjustments.

attributes.action: Cancel plans to open a trading office in Raleigh North Carolina
attributes.background: Recently North Carolina has passed a bill dubbed 'HB 2' which has "voided all local ordinances protecting LGBT rights". As a result many business ventures have removed or cancelled their investment plans in the state. The UK should also refuse to support a region that legalises LGBT discrimination.
attributes.additional_details: "North Carolina has lost a string of big investment ventures over Governor Pat McCrory’s decision to sign the contentious HB 2 – which voided all local ordinances protecting LGBT rights, banned transgender people from using their preferred bathroom, and permits businesses to discriminate against LGBT people on the grounds of religious belief" http://www.pinknews.co.uk/2016/07/26/uk-government-to-open-trade-hub-in-north-carolina-despite-controversy-over-anti-lgbt-law/

attributes.action: Allow cystic fibrosis patients decide when they are ready for a lung transplant
attributes.background: My brother in law needs a lung transplant as he suffers from cystic fibrosis, he has been in hospital for most of this year when he gets out he is back in within 12 days he is only 22 his lung function is around 30% and his consultant says he cant have a lung transplant yet should be his choice
attributes.additional_details: Every human being should have a good quality of life,  why should 1000s of people die every year not just with cystic fibrosis but everyone who needs an organ transplant? Most people die as a result of being placed on the transplant list to late, My brother in law who needs a lung transplant does not take life for granted he does not drink, smoke or take drugs he shows courage and determination all the time people like him are an inspiration for us all let it be his choice

attributes.action: Give England its own National Anthem
attributes.background:
Wales, Scotland, and Ireland have their own National Anthems.  In fact, all our neighbours do, but not us, not England.  
During England's football match, the Welsh were able to sing their proud and stirring Welsh National Anthem, but they also sang ours, because it belongs to the UK, not England.
attributes.additional_details:
A National Anthem is about identity, which is particularly important during major sporting fixtures, as well as any public fixtures and competitions between the countries of the United Kingdom.

England is too often left behind, and it is surely time, that in common with her neighbours, she has a National Anthem which is her own.  I want to petition Parliament to consider my proposal, and I suggest 'Land of Hope and Glory' as something everyone can get behind.

Please consider supporting this.

attributes.action: Make Counselling and Psychotherapy a professional qualification.
attributes.background:
Anyone is able to set up in private practice and call themselves a Counsellor or Psychotherapist.
I would like a minimum qualification that is recognised by a regulatory body, such as the BACP, to benchmark a qualification to prevent poorly trained or unqualified individuals from practising.

attributes.action: There needs to be a cull of seagulls in Britain
attributes.background: The seagull menace in Dundee and Angus has become to much for the residents to bear and we request a cull. We also believe this to be a nationwide problem and believe most coastal towns at least would support this cull.
attributes.additional_details: We are sick of the noise pollution, attacks, destruction, etc etc and call on this Government to act

attributes.action: Women and Equalitiy Committee to conduct a full review of the TransInquiry
attributes.background: The Women and Equalities Commision published the Transgender Equality Report on the 7th July 2016. It does not address any of the main concerned of Transgended Men and Women in the UK. It pastes over cracks in the systems, law and the rights of Trans people. Our community demands a full review.
attributes.additional_details: There are 35 recommendations writhin the report and the majority are incomplete. The Transgender community requires that a further review is taken to ensure that the Women and Equalities Commision continue the work that have done to fully address all 35 recommendations and too ensure all are fully addressed in the shortest possible timeframe. This report must be treated as an interim report that is a work in progress. We demand the right to appropriate treatment and complete self determination.

attributes.action: Make FREE  temporary housing provisions for the homeless and support accessible
attributes.background: I want the government to make FREE temporary housing provisions available and accessible throughout the UK and give our homeless support to find permanent housing, lifestyles support such as counselling so they can regain a functioning position within society again
attributes.additional_details: More and More homeless are appearing on the streets of the UK, some have lost everything and have nowhere to turn so do the best they can by sleeping on the streets and begging , some are war veterans who have fought then been cast to one side as they as if a person is expendable, so turn to drugs and alcohol to fade out the pain. Homelessness is not normal and these people need support and not to be cast aside, ignored, left to freeze to death on the street or forced into crime to survive.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for schools to teach basic BSL.
attributes.background: Communication  in children is very important. But what happens when the only way to communicate is by sign? Not being able to communicate and make friends can lower a child's self-esteem.Make it mandatory for schools to teach basic BSL in schools.

attributes.action: Make physical appearance a protected characteristic.
attributes.background: People feel victimised by an unjust decision to restrict their identity. Having their own hair style and colour makes people feel more comfortable in society, this can make people feel more comfortable with themselves. This should be accepted to give everyone an equal opportunity to be themselves.
attributes.additional_details: In schools, teachers try to dictate hair colour and style. Article 10 of the Human Rights Act states that students should be able to express themselves and make them feel identified without the interference from the authority (teachers being the authority in schools). Also, the same idea applies in article 14. This article was created to try and allow everyone to have equal opportunities for something they may otherwise be judged upon. So why doesn't Article 14 protect physical appearance? All other protected characteristics are things that make people feel more accepted in society because in the past they were not as widely accepted. People should not change the way they look from a style that makes them feel comfortable with themselves, so don't make them.

attributes.action: Make it an offence to desecrate National flags or symbols of National importance
attributes.background: Recent events such as the burning of poppies during the remembrance parades have caused anger and division in our society.  Such acts are offensive to the majority of UK citizens and are completely unacceptable in a civilised society such as ours.
attributes.additional_details: The burning or desecration of any of the UK National flags is deeply offensive to a large majority of UK citizens as is burning or destroying of poppies during the period when such symbols are worn to honour the fallen.  We, the petitioners demand that such acts be classed as hate crimes and that the offenders be prosecuted accordingly under the appropriate legislation.

attributes.action: Continue the Rail Electrification Works between Cardiff and London via Bristol
attributes.background:
On 8th November, it has been reported that electrification works on the railways between Cardiff and London via Bristol, among other works, will be arbitrarily and indefinitely delayed from the previous schedule.

This is an insult to the people of Bristol, Wales and the South West.
attributes.additional_details:
"Costly and disruptive electrification works" have already been underway in Bristol and the Severn Tunnel. To delay capitalizing on the progress that has already been made is to ask the region to absorb the economic penalties from those works without view of payback in improved service.

We urge the minister Paul Maynard to honour his party's manifesto pledge, reconsider this decision and continue with the works as planned.

https://goo.gl/IpVbRY

https://goo.gl/osNOoe

attributes.action: Restrict the usage of fireworks to a 2 hour time slot (6-8pm or 7-9pm)
attributes.background: The law in the UK currently states that you may not set off fireworks between 11pm and 7am, except for Diwali, New Year and Chinese New Year, when it's 1am. Requesting a change from these hours to a reasonable 2 hour time slot will help people with young families and pets during this time.
attributes.additional_details:
Built up areas/residential areas: The sound of multiple displays up until 11pm/1am can be deafening as the bangs reverberate off buildings and wake sleeping children/stress out pets.
Fireworks have a 120 db sound limit: This is the same as a thunderclap. With multiple fireworks going off simultaneously and sounding like a thunderstorm for up to 5/7 hours straight, this can be extremely frightening for young children, babies and pets, as well as the elderly and any servicemen and women with PTSD.

attributes.action: Debate whether self-regulation of the press is adequate.
attributes.background: The UK press is constantly coming under fire for misrepresenting stories and misleading the public with inflammatory opinion pieces that purport to be news items.
attributes.additional_details:
“the press is given significant and special rights in this country ... With these rights, however, come responsibilities to the public interest: to respect the truth, to obey the law and to uphold the rights and liberties of individuals. In short, to honour the very principles proclaimed and articulated by the industry itself (and to a large degree reflected in the Editors’ Code of Practice)”.
- Sir Brian Leveson

Some newspapers are clearly failing to 'respect the truth'.

attributes.action: Allow young people with 'controlled/managed' Asthma to join the Army.
attributes.background: Thousands of honest, dedicated young people have been denied recruitment to the Army simply for being diagnosed Asthmatic. Many young people who are physically fit and mentally capable are still being unfairly refused enrolment for receiving preventative treatment which keeps Asthma symptoms at bay
attributes.additional_details: Asthma is a life long condition that in many cases can be controlled/managed to the point where the sufferers symptoms have no effect on their daily life and activities. Thousands of young people are being unfairly denied the chance to defend their country and build themselves a solid and secure future simply because they receive preventative medication which keeps their Asthma symptoms at bay. This is unfair and outdated!

attributes.action: Tax on Premier League transfers to install and maintain free to use 4G pitches.
attributes.background: Introduce a tax on all Premier league transfers to raise funds to install and maintain 4G pitches in as many towns in England/Wales as possible that are free for kids/sports clubs/schools etc to use. Many children throughout England and Wales have to play football on inadequate pitches.
attributes.additional_details: Many football pitches are (water logged/on a hill/dangerous/ridden with dog muck) despite there being record breaking amounts of money in the English Premier league. £1.165bn spent to date this season already. Health of kids would increase from these pitches as would anti-social behaviour in communities. National football team would benefit as more children given opportunity to play on 'fit for purpose' pitches and fulfill their potential.

attributes.action: Ban Kirpans (ceremonial dagger) in primary schools
attributes.background: My children's primary school has just announced that they have passed a policy allowing children (aged 4 upwards) to wear a Kirpan if they have taken promises under Amrit.
attributes.additional_details: To me, a dagger is a dagger and has absolutely no place in a primary school.  I would like to see the Goverment review the situation and bring a complete ban on Kirpans in primary schools, as despite the policies in place, I do not feel happy allowing my children to be in an environment where other children are carrying daggers or knives.

attributes.action: Move the Houses of Parliament to Birmingham.
attributes.background: Houses of Parliament restoration work is estimated to cost £4 billion. We propose a new building on the outskirts of Birmingham near to the Airport and Exhibition Centre. A geographically central home in our second city would be created for Parliament and would provide excellent transport links.

attributes.action: Companies get tax benefits to sell recycled tech or parts rather than new tech
attributes.background: Every year, millions of tons of operational tech is thrown away. For example in Europe, the average phone is used for 1.5yrs before being swapped, but most actually last ~6yrs. If the tax system were changed, companies would be encouraged to promote reuse or recycling of old technology.
attributes.additional_details:
See
http://www.electronicstakeback.com/wp-content/uploads/Facts-and-Figures-on-E-Waste-and-Recycling.pdf

attributes.action: I'd like Narcissistic Abuse and Covert Bullying to be recognised as an offense
attributes.background: Narcissistic Abuse and Covert Bullying needs to be recognised as a crime. The victim is often left feeling helpless and controlled. Narcissists are sneaky and will attack while hiding behind others (to guard their reputation). Its a form of bullying which includes smear campaigns and 'gaslighting'
attributes.additional_details:
The definition of 'victim' is A person who is tricked or duped or A person who has come to feel helpless and passive in the face of misfortune or ill treatment.

Narcissists trick their victim, getting a thrill from manipulating them and making fools of them. If the victim retaliates, the narcissist will unleash a smear campaign, ruining that persons reputation. Its a form of covert bullying, which leaves lifes and careers in tatters. Narcissistic abuse can happen anywhere and is soul destroying
